results.title: The Tale of Peter Rabbit and Benjamin Bunny
results.creator_credit: Dennis Abey, Geoff Dunbar, Ginger Gibbons and Grand Slamm Partnership
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The World of Peter Rabbit and friends”.
Beatrix Potter’s beautifully illustrated books have long been a favourite with children. Her stories of the mischievous cousins, Peter Rabbit and Benjamin Bunny, come to life on the screen in this delightful animated adaptation. The video includes a live-action introduction dramatising Beatrix Potter and the animals that inspired her books.

results.title: The World of Peter Rabbit and friends
results.creator_credit: John Coates, Frederick Warne and Company and TVC London
results.brief_description: The delightful drawings and stories of Beatrix Potter are stunningly recreated in this excellent series. From the mischievious Peter Rabbit and his near fatal encounter with Mr. McGregor, to Jemima Puddle-duck and her naive trust in the Fox, these stories will entertain and stimulate young minds.

results.title: X-files = X files. Season 2. Box set
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The X-files = The X files”.
Season one of “The X-Files” concluded with the government shutting down the X-files project leaving agents Dana Scully (Gillian Anderson) and Fox Mulder (David Duchovny) relieved of their special duties. At the commencement of Season two (Ep. 1 ‘Little green men’) Scully and Mulder have been deliberately kept apart by unknown government forces and are back doing rank and file FBI investigations. Believing that the agency keeps them under constant surveillance, Scully and Mulder must now meet in secret. Agent Mulder has lost hope in ever finding ‘the truth’ behind his sisters alien abduction, while agent Scully has become despondent with her extra-ordinary FBI teaching duties. Of course that doesn’t last and the two find themselves together again investigating a recent UFO sighting in Puerto Rico which the government is desperately trying to cover up. The second season delves even deeper into the mythologies set up in season one, accumulating with agent Scully’s abduction (Ep. 5 ‘Duane Barry’) and agent Mulder discovering some shocking revelations about his sister’s disappearance (Ep. 16 ‘Colony’). In season two creator Chris Carter creates a nice role reversal between the agents, as the scientifically minded Scully begins to entertain the existence of extraterrestrial life, while Mulder begins to lose interest in finding out the ‘truth’. Season two also sees the introduction of Krycek (Nicholas Lea), a duplicitous FBI agent who is initially assigned as Mulder’s partner when Scully goes missing (Ep. 4 ‘Sleepless’). Cast also includes William B. Davis and Mitch Pileggi.

results.title: The World of three
results.creator_credit: George Kaczender, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Home can be big and bewildering and the people in it can seem larger than life in the eyes of a three-year old boy. In this film such a little boy is observed in his response to his home environment, and what it means to be on the receiving end of what is called “child training” is reflected.

results.title: X-Files = X files. Season 3. Box set [DVD]
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The X-files = The X files”.
With season three of the X-Files, creator Chris Carter and his team of writers introduce an unexpected element into the show’s formula - humour. Having built a loyal fanbase of ‘X-philes’, the show begins to confidently toy with expectations, offering sly takes on classic American ‘drive-in’ movies (Ep. 12 ‘War of the Coprophages,’ which also teases the audience and Scully with a Mulder love interest named Bambi), to all-out self parody (Ep. 20 ‘Jose Chung’s From outer space’.) However, Carter doesn’t allow the series to slip entirely into send-up, remaining faithful to what originally drew the fans in - the ‘mythology’ episodes. At the commencement of season 3 (Ep. 1 ‘The Blessing way’) Mulder is missing, presumed dead, after the ‘cigarette-smoking man’ ordered the destruction of a train carriage that he was hiding in at the end of series 2. Scully on the other hand is convinced Mulder is still alive. Of course, Mulder shows up eventually and before too long the two are reunited, but this time their investigations are of a more personal nature. Mulder wanting to avenge his father’s death at the end of season 2, while Scully experiences her own family tragedy (Ep. 2 ‘Paper clip.’) These two tragic losses ultimately strengthen the bond between the agents; needing to depend even more on each others strength and trust. Season 3 provides plenty of other challenges for the FBI agents as they encounter old foes, (Krycek makes an unwelcome appearance) and uncover a secret government plot that will ultimately shed light on Scully’s abduction (Ep. 9 “Nisei”). Cast includes: Gillian Anderson, David Duchovny, Mitch Pileggi, William B. Davis, Nicholas Lea.

results.title: The X-files = The X files
results.brief_description: Chris Carter’s long running cult series which explores the paranormal and the paranoid, introduced us to the covert world of FBI agents Dana Scully (Gillian Anderson) and Fox Mulder (David Duchovney) and its now famous mantra, “The truth is out there.”

results.title: Your sleep and rest
results.creator_credit: David Bennett and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Life Science”.
Emphasises the need for body cells to replenish their energy and building materials and to eliminate wastes which accumulate. Shows the part played by the circulatory system in this process. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: X-files = X files. Season 5. Box set
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The X-files = The X files”.
The last season of the X-files ended with the shock suicide of Agent Mulder (David Duchovny). Is this the end of the X-files? Is Mulder really dead? Season 5 opens with a 2 part episode (eps. 1 & 2, Redux) which answers these questions (of course Mulder is not dead!) and also brings to light the mystery surrounding Scully’s fatal cancer. The writers don’t disappoint as Mulder discovers a secret research facility that may hold the cure to Scully’s illness, which also leads him to some revelations about his abducted sister. There are many surprises in stall for Scully and Mulder in season 5, including a mystery child who may or may not be Scully’s daughter (ep. 6, Christmas Carol) and the sudden appearance of an old flame of agent Mulder’s, played by Mimi Rogers (ep. 20, The End). By this stage “The X-files” was enjoying enormous popularity, winning fresh fans and critical praise. The series popularity even drew novelists William Gibson (ep. 11, Kill switch) and Stephen King (ep. 10, Chinga) in to write for the show. Aside form bringing humour into the mix again (ep. 12, Bad blood, ep. 3, Unusual suspects), the creators began to experiment with the show’s form, including an episode shot entirely in black and white (ep. 5, The Post-modern prometheus). “The X-files” also achieved a first for television by having the end of the season continue onto the big screen (X-files the movie: Fight the future). This was untested ground in that viewers would have to see the movie if they wanted to find out the answers to the cliffhanger ending of the season. There’s even a nice self-referential joke in season 5 with the appearance of Darren McGavin (ep. 15, Travelers) from “The Night Stalker”, the show that originally inspired Chris Carter to create “The X-files.” Cast includes: David Duchovny, Gillian Anderson, Mitch Pileggi, Nicholas Lea, William B. Davis.

results.title: Your protection against disease
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Life Science”.
Illustrates how germs spread disease, how the body controls micro organisms that enter the body and how good hygiene habits prevent disease.
